data.title: Emergency Earthquake Relief Needed
data.summary: The vulnerable communities in Morocco faced severe impacts from the 6.8-magnitude earthquake. Tragically, over 2,000 lives were lost, with thousands more injured. Many awaiting rescue.

featuredImage.alt: Africa Relief: Morocco Earthquake Relief Fund Aid

content.heading: More than 300,000 people have been affected in Marrakech and surrounding areas. Join ARCD USA in rebuilding shattered lives and sparking new hope.
content.description: Amidst the aftermath of a catastrophic earthquake, Morocco mourns over 2,800 lives lost and the deep impact on 100,000 children. Urgent needs include shelter, clean water, medical aid, and nourishment. Let’s unite and extend a lifeline, rebuilding shattered lives.

content.heading: How is ARCD's Relief responding?
content.description: ARCD’s Relief team swiftly mobilized in response to the catastrophic earthquake in Morocco. As families grapple with the loss of over 2,800 lives, our focus was on urgent necessities: providing shelter, clean water, medical aid, and essential nourishment. Our unified efforts now aim to extend a lifeline, aiding in the reconstruction of shattered lives and offering hope amidst the devastation.

content.heading: Critical Aid Needed
content.description:
1- Clean Water: Essential to prevent waterborne diseases caused by contaminated floodwaters.
2- Food Supplies: Including feeding projects and non-perishable food items.
3- Clothing, Blankets, and Mattresses: Vital necessities for those who have lost everything in the floods.
4- Shelters: Build safe havens to restore security amidst turmoil
5- Your support ensures these essentials reach those in need, safeguarding lives and fostering recovery in the aftermath of the disaster.

content.heading: Empower Survivors
content.description: United for igniting change. Your contribution powers our rapid response, reaching those affected by the crisis with the necessary aid

featuredImage.alt: Impact non profit: Team analyzing data for community improvement projects
Ruins of buildings in Morocco following a devastating earthquake, with rescue workers in action.
